required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of GastimunHp Plus in Supporting the Treatment of Peptic Ulcer Disease With Helicobacter Pylori Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of GastimunHp Plus in Supporting the Treatment of Peptic Ulcer Disease With Helicobacter Pylori Infection

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Gastroenterology and Hepatology, Vietnam

clinical_study.source: Institute of Gastroenterology and Hepatology, Vietnam

brief_summary.textblock: Challenges in the treatment of Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) include increasing antimicrobial resistance and patient's low tolerance to some regimens. Lactobacillus johnsonii (L. johnsonii) and Immunoglobulin Y (IgY) have been shown to decrease the amount and activity of H. pylori in human stomach and can increase patient's tolerance. We conduct a single-center double-masked randomized controlled trial to evaluate the effectiveness of GastimunHp Plus (a product combining L. johnsonii and IgY) in improving the clearance of H. pylori after six to eight weeks of treatment and side effects of H. pylori treatment. H. pylori is tested by C13- or C14-urea breath test.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Recruitment was slow and disrupted by COVID-19.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: The investigational product (IP) is compared with a placebo. The IP and placebo are manufactured by the sponsor and then sent to the trial pharmacist. They are only different in a number in the package label, and only the sponsor knows which number is the IP and will call them "product I" and "product II". This labelling is not revealed to the study team, the trial pharmacist, and the biostatistician. In the random number sequences generated by the biostatistician, the study numbers will be allocated to either "product I" or "product II". The trial pharmacist is responsible for making product bags using study numbers and allocation given by the biostatistician. The product bags are transferred to the study team. In this way, the study team and patients are completely masked to the allocation.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with negative urea breath test after 6-8 weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: Six to eight weeks after recruitment
primary_outcome.description: Patients tested negative with Helicobacter pylori using C13- or C14-urea breath test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with clinical improvement after 6-8 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six to eight weeks after recruitment

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with adverse effects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six to eight weeks after recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: Any adverse effects that are deemed related to the investigational product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with improvement of lesions on endoscopy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six to eight weeks after recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of lesions detected on baseline on upper gastrointestinal endoscopy. Improvement was determined by expert's opinion.

arm_group.description: 1 sachet of GastimunHp Plus twice daily during or after meals.
1 sachet of placebo twice daily during or after meals.

intervention.description: Each sachet contains 6mg of IgY and 50 mg of heat-killed Lactobacillus johnsonii No. 1088.
The placebo contains neither IgY nor L. johnsonii.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with gastritis, duodenitis, or peptic ulcer.
- Tested positive with Helicobacter pylori using C13- or C14-urea breath test or urease test.
- Indicated for Helicobacter pylori eradication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspected malignant lesions.
- Children under 10 years of age; pregnant or lactating women.
- Allergic to chicken egg.
